subject: Technology
title: The App Economy
description: A short lesson to help you apply The App Economy.

hook.text: Before 2008, the idea that you could earn a living by making phone apps didn't exist.

buildup.text: Apple's App Store opened with 500 apps. Developers could reach millions of users with zero upfront cost.

discovery.text: Tiny teams built apps that generated millions in revenue. A single indie game could make someone rich overnight.

twist.text: Apple takes a 30% cut of every sale. Developers call it the 'Apple tax' and lawsuits have followed.

climax.text: The app economy now generates over $500 billion a year. It created an entire new class of business.

punchline.text: Apple didn't build the apps. It built the store that made them possible.

quiz.question: How much does Apple typically take from App Store sales?
